content.new:
In trying to work as we will in the real run, I am sending commands and receiving data across a network, with one machine running the sim and another doing the commanding.

I am able to use tools like rviz and send commands for joints to move just fine
content.old:
In trying to work as we will in the real run, I am sending commands and receiving data across a network, with one machine running the sim and another doing the commanding.

I am able to use tools like rviz just fine with the typical ROS network setup.

title.new: world frame does not go with tf across network
title.old: world frame does not go with tf across machines

issue.title: world frame does not go with tf across network
world frame does not go with tf across network

message.raw:
OK, I'm resolving the issue as I have been able to get the world frame via a VPN connection, so it is possible with the right network setup.

It may be worth starting another issue to understand in what form we will see world frame in the actual competition.  Also, that is such a critical component, we need to have clarification very soon.
message.html:
OK, I'm resolving the issue as I have been able to get the world frame via a VPN connection, so it is possible with the right network setup.

It may be worth starting another issue to understand in what form we will see world frame in the actual competition. Also, that is such a critical component, we need to have clarification very soon.
